Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style or Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; large lotus-palmette in added white outline with added red centre; exterior: short diagonal strokes between pairs of dilute lines; below, pendant triangle with double outline as filling ornament.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For a parallels regarding the exterior pattern decorations, see Lemos 1991, 269, no. 653, pl. 84 from the Aphaia Temple on Aegina. Filling ornament is also seen in the earlier vases of the Grand Style. For parallels, see Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.76.1894 and GR.77.1894.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0667) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
